content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

To define the `FloatWithUnits` struct in Julia, you can use the following code:
```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end
```
Now, to write a `show` method for it that concatenates the value and unit with a space, you can use the following code:
```julia
function show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, fwu.value)
    print(io, " ")
    print(io, fwu.unit)
end
```
This method will print the value and unit of the `FloatWithUnits` struct in the format "1.8 meters", for example.
